TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1132
TEI.2.document_title: Amy White to Stephen F Austin, 06-07-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Amy White to Austin, June 7, 1825. Conflict of surveys.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1132

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Amy White to Austin, June 7, 1825. Conflict of surveys.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**person_mentioned*Col Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir I have been informed that *person_mentioned*Mr Isaac Hughs the survayer*/person_mentioned* has returned my survey, he has not finished it he has taken in an improvement whare *person_mentioned*John Jones*/person_mentioned* lives it was not done by my direction but *person_mentioned*ray suninglaw*/person_mentioned* told him to do so I wranted to pay *person_mentioned*Jones*/person_mentioned* for his improvement and he would not sell it wishing to hold the land it is not my wish to take any persons right from them and would willingly take my land so that it would not interfer with him say *location_mentioned*lower down the riever*/location_mentioned* as I am a *person_mentioned*lone Woman*/person_mentioned* would you be as good as to inform me if I am to hold the land if not will I have to pay the *person_mentioned*survayer */person_mentioned*for what he has done before I get my right I wish my land to be survayed complete*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*San Jasinto*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="06-07-1825">June 7th 1825*/date_mentioned*. */p*
*/div1*
